text:
MASX-Hotspots uses 18 distinct LangGraph agent implementations, each with a specialized role in the flashpoint detection and analysis pipeline. Here's a breakdown of the key agents:

Core Detection & Analysis Agents:
 Flashpoint LLM Agent: The primary agent that identifies and extracts potential geopolitical flashpoints from raw data.
 Flashpoint Validator Agent: Cross-checks and validates the flashpoints identified by the LLM agent for accuracy and relevance.
 Domain Classifier Agent: Classifies the nature or domain of each detected event e.g., military, diplomatic, economic, environmental.
 Query Planner Agent: Strategically plans and generates optimized search queries to gather more information on each flashpoint.
 Language Agent: Detects the language of source materials.
 Translation Agent: Translates content using the NLLB model to support analysis across 50+ languages.

Data Ingestion & Processing Agents:
 Google RSS Feeder Agent: Aggregates and processes real-time data from Google News RSS feeds.
 GDELT Feed Agent: Aggregates and processes structured event data from the GDELT Project.
 Feed Finalizer Agent: Merges, deduplicates, and finalizes the aggregated feed data for downstream analysis.

Support & Orchestration Agents:
The system also includes agents for Event Analysis, Fact Checking, Language Resolution, News Fetching, Validation, Logging/Auditing, Memory Management, and Merge Deduplication.

This multi-agent architecture operates on a fan-out/fan-in parallel processing model, allowing the system to efficiently scan, classify, and analyze global data streams 24/7 to identify emerging geopolitical risks.
